org.bluedb.api

Interface BlueCollection<V extends java.io.Serializable>

  • Type Parameters:
    V - the object type of values to be serialized into the collection
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BlueCollectionOnDisk

    public interface BlueCollection<V extends java.io.Serializable>
    A BlueCollection represents a persisted map of keys (of type BlueKey) to values of object type V. A collection has a name (to distinguish between collections in a BlueDb instance), a key type, and a value type.

    • Method Detail

      • createIndex

        <K extends ValueKey> BlueIndex<K,V> createIndex(java.lang.String name,
                                                java.lang.Class<K> keyType,
                                                KeyExtractor<K,V> keyExtractor)
                                         throws BlueDbException
        Creates (or returns existing) BlueIndex that maps objects of type ValueKey (UUIDKey, StringKey, IntegerKey, LongKey) to values in the collection.
        Type Parameters:
        K - the key type of the index or the type of data that the collection is being indexed on. It must be a concretion of ValueKey (UUIDKey, StringKey, LongKey, or IntegerKey).
        Parameters:
        name - index name (one index per name per each collection)
        keyType - the type of each key which is used to lookup a value using the index (this must match the keyType of any existing index with the same name)
        keyExtractor - a function that maps a value to the keys by which the value should be indexed. The appropriate subclass can be used and would be more simple to implement. These include UUIDIndexKeyExtractor, StringIndexKeyExtractor, IntegerIndexKeyExtractor, and LongIndexKeyExtractor
        Returns:
        a BlueIndex object (existing index if it exists, otherwise a newly created index)
        Throws:
        BlueDbException - if the index exists but is not compatible with these types

      • getIndex

        <K extends ValueKey> BlueIndex<K,V> getIndex(java.lang.String name,
                                             java.lang.Class<K> keyType)
                                      throws BlueDbException
        Returns existing BlueIndex that maps objects of type keyType to values in the collection.
        Type Parameters:
        K - the key type of the index or the type of data that the collection is being indexed on. It must be a concretion of ValueKey (UUIDKey, StringKey, LongKey, or IntegerKey).
        Parameters:
        name - index name (one index per name per each collection)
        keyType - the type of each key which is used to lookup a value using the index (this must match the keyType of any existing index with the same name)
        Returns:
        a BlueIndex with the same name if it exists and has the same keyType
        Throws:
        BlueDbException - if index doesn't exist or has a different keyType

      • contains

        boolean contains(BlueKey key)
          throws BlueDbException
        Returns true if the collection contains a value for the given key.
        Parameters:
        key - the key that may or may not be in collection
        Returns:
        true if the collection contains a value for the given key, else false
        Throws:
        BlueDbException - if the type of key was not the type specified when the collection was created

      • insert

        void insert(BlueKey key,
            V value)
     throws BlueDbException
        Inserts the given key value pair
        Parameters:
        key - key where value should be saved (must match the keyType specified when the collection was created)
        value - value to be saved for the key
        Throws:
        BlueDbException - if the key type is not the type specified when the collection was created

      • batchUpsert

        void batchUpsert(java.util.Map<BlueKey,V> values)
          throws BlueDbException
        Inserts or replaces the given key value pairs. Batch methods are much more efficient than calling non-batch methods many times.
        Parameters:
        values - the key value pairs to insert. Key types must match the keyType specified when the collection was created.
        Throws:
        BlueDbException - if the key types do not match the type specified when the collection was created

      • get

        V get(BlueKey key)
throws BlueDbException
        Returns the value to which the specified key is mapped, or null if this map contains no mapping for the key
        Parameters:
        key - the key for the desired value
        Returns:
        the value to which the specified key is mapped, or null if this map contains no mapping for the key
        Throws:
        BlueDbException - if the key is not the same type specified when the collection was created

      • update

        void update(BlueKey key,
            Updater<V> updater)
     throws BlueDbException
        Mutates the value for the given key by passing it to the given updater
        Parameters:
        key - The key for the value which will be updated
        updater - a function that mutates the value to which the specified key is mapped
        Throws:
        BlueDbException - if type of key is not the type specified when the collection was created or if updater throws an exception

      • replace

        void replace(BlueKey key,
             Mapper<V> updater)
      throws BlueDbException
        Replaces the value for the given key by passing it to the given updater
        Parameters:
        key - the key for the value which will be replaced
        updater - a function that returns the value that should replace the value to which the specified key is mapped
        Throws:
        BlueDbException - if type of key is not the type specified when the collection was created or if updater throws an exception

      • delete

        void delete(BlueKey key)
     throws BlueDbException
        Deletes the value for the given key
        Parameters:
        key - the key for the value which will be deleted
        Throws:
        BlueDbException - if type of key is not the type specified when the collection was created

      • batchDelete

        void batchDelete(java.util.Collection<BlueKey> keys)
          throws BlueDbException
        Deletes the values for the given keys. Batch methods are much more efficient than calling non-batch methods many times.
        Parameters:
        keys - the keys for the values which will be deleted
        Throws:
        BlueDbException - if type of key is not the type specified when the collection was created

      • query

        BlueQuery<V> query()
        Creates a BlueQuery object which can be used to build and execute a query against this collection.
        Returns:
        a BlueQuery object which can be used to build and execute a query against this collection.

      • getLastKey

        BlueKey getLastKey()
        Returns the key with the highest grouping number that exists in this collection
        Returns:
        the key with the highest grouping number that exists in this collection
